docs.title: Kraftlin
docs.text: Kraftlin is a set of focused, type-safe Kotlin libraries for building Minecraft plugins. It provides small, composable modules for common plugin concerns like commands, configuration, and messages.

docs.title: Quickstart
docs.text:
• Pick the module you need and add it as a dependency.
  • Use the Paper integrations if you are building for Paper.
  • Keep database credentials in a separate database.yml for safer operations.

docs.title: Modules
docs.text:
• Config: Type-safe Kotlin DSL for structured configuration.
  • Command: Kotlin DSL over Brigadier with Paper helpers.
  • Message: Kotlin DSL for Adventure components.

docs.title: Command
docs.text: The command module provides a Kotlin DSL over Mojang Brigadier and integrates with Paper for typed argument builders and execution context.

docs.title: Paper integration
docs.text:
Use Paper helpers to register commands with strong typing and clear structure. See the module README for examples:

  • kraftlin-command-paper/README.md

docs.title: Config
docs.text: The config module provides a type-safe Kotlin DSL for structured configuration, plus Paper helpers for working with config.yml and additional YAML files.

docs.title: Paper helpers
docs.text:
Use the Paper integration to bind Kotlin properties to YAML values:

class Config(plugin: Plugin) : AbstractConfig(wrapConfig(plugin)) {
    val interval: Long by config("spawn_interval_ticks", 1200L)
}

docs.title: Database configuration
docs.text:
Load database settings from a separate database.yml in the plugin data folder:

val database = loadSqlConfiguration(plugin)

We highly encourage this separation. It serves several purposes: 1. It reduces the risk of accidentally sharing sensitive data or committing it to a repository. 2. It allows you to easily switch between different database backends without changing the primary config. 3. DevOps can easily automate database configurations.

Legacy database.properties files are migrated automatically on first load.

docs.title: Message
docs.text:
The message module provides a Kotlin DSL for building Adventure components, with Paper helpers for sending messages and working with audiences.

See the module README for examples:

  • kraftlin-message-paper/README.md

docs.title: Paper
docs.text: Paper modules provide integration with the Paper API for configuration, commands, and messages.

docs.title: Future platforms
docs.text: Additional platforms like Velocity can be added without changing core modules.
